cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles east of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north-northwest tonight, then north on Tuesday night while paralleling/ skirting Florida’s west coast and heading toward the Florida Big Bend before moving inland across Georgia and the Carolinas.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning (also Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch west of the Ochlockonee River to Indian Pass, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm & Storm Surge Warnings from Flamingo, FL northward to the Ochlockonee River including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from the Florida Keys through the Big Bend region
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm winds 35–50 kt (40–60 mph) with higher gusts possible Tuesday night into early Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft inundation possible in Tampa Bay, including Manatee County shoreline, if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with local maxima up to 8 inches could cause flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous marine conditions and high waves along the port approaches.
